013package org.apache.juneau.svl.vars;
014
015import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
017
018/**
019 * A transformational variable resolver that returns substring for given start and end (optional)
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * The format for this var is one of the following:
023 * <ul>
024 *    <li><js>"$ST{arg,start}"</js>
025 *    <li><js>"$ST{arg,start,end}"</js>
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * <p>
029 *
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
032 * <p class='bjava'>
033 *    <jc>// Create a variable resolver that resolves system properties and $SW vars.</jc>
034 *    VarResolver <jv>varResolver</jv> = VarResolver.<jsm>create</jsm>().vars(SubstringVar.<jk>class</jk>, SystemPropertiesVar.<jk>class</jk>).build();
035 *
036 *    <jc>// Use it!</jc>
037 *    System.<jsf>out</jsf>.println(<jv>varResolver</jv>.resolve(<js>"Version = $ST{$P{java.version}, 0, 3}"</js>));
038 * </p>
039 *
040 * <p>
041 * Since this is a {@link MultipartVar}, any variables contained in the result will be recursively resolved.
042 * <br>Likewise, if the arguments contain any variables, those will be resolved before they are passed to this var.
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
045 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/SimpleVariableLanguageBasics">Simple Variable Language Basics</a>
046 * </ul>
047 */
048public class SubstringVar extends MultipartVar {
049
050   /** The name of this variable. */
051   public static final String NAME = "ST";
052
053   /**
054    * Constructor.
055    */
056   public SubstringVar() {
057      super(NAME);
058   }
059
060   @Override /* MultipartVar */
061   public String resolve(VarResolverSession session, String[] args) {
062      Utils.assertArg(args.length >= 2 && args.length <= 3, "Invalid number of arguments passed to $ST var.  Must have 2 or 3 arguments.");
063
064      String stringArg = args[0];
065      String result = "";
066      if (args.length == 2) {
067         int start = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
068         if (start >= 0 && start <= stringArg.length())
069            result = stringArg.substring(start);
070         if (start < 0 && -start <= stringArg.length())
071            result = stringArg.substring(stringArg.length() + start);
072      }
073      else if (args.length == 3) {
074         int start = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
075         int end = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
076         if (start >= 0 && start < stringArg.length() && end >= 0 && end <= stringArg.length() && start < end)
077            result = stringArg.substring(start, end);
078      }
079      return result;
080   }
081}
